At least one year of relevant work experience is highly recommended but not required.

EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum score requirements are: TOEFL iBT 79, IELTS 6.5, PTE 58, or Duolingo English Test 110.
Requirements: Students may apply for admission to the accelerated BS/MPH program at any time after they have completed a minimum of 60 undergraduate credit hours. A minimum GPA of 3.2 on all college or university courses is required. Application materials include: Application to the Graduate School, Statement of objectives (1-2 pages), Three letters of recommendation, Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions, Resume or curriculum vitae.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT score of 79, IELTS score of 6.5, PTE score of 58, or a Duolingo English Test score of 110.
Requirements:
Students applying for admission to the MSPH program are expected to have completed a baccalaureate degree with an overall GPA of 3.0 or higher. For students with degrees from a U.S. institution, official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended are required. For international students, a transcript evaluation by a credentialing agency is required.

In addition to the application form and fee, all applicants must submit a written statement describing their interest in the public health program and career goals. Applicants also need to provide a curriculum vitae or résumé and arrange for the submission of three letters of reference.

The MPH program at K-State has received a GRE waiver. We no longer require the GRE for admission to the program. All other admission requirements are still in place.

International students must also meet K-State’s general requirements for graduate admission. Information on these requirements is available from the Graduate School.
Fees: The total tuition and fees for the entire 42 credit hour program is currently estimated at $22,000 for all students regardless of residency status.

EnglishScore: Applicants who are not native speakers of English must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT 79, IELTS 6.5, PTE 58, or Duolingo 110. Requirements are waived for applicants with a bachelor's degree from the United States, United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, or English-speaking provinces of Canada.
Requirements:
All applicants must submit the following materials:

Online graduate school application.
Graduate school application fee.
One official transcript from each college or university attended. GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework is required.
Statement of goals and career objectives (no more than 2 pages).
Resume or curriculum vitae (no more than 2 pages).
Three letters of reference.
For international students for whom English is not a first language, a TOEFL, IELTS, or PTE score is required.
The GRE is optional. However, if the applicant feels that their scores will enhance their application, they may be submitted.

EnglishScore: All students, domestic or international, for whom English is a second language must meet the English proficiency requirement. This can be met by earning a required score on one of the following exams: TOEFL iBT score of 79 or higher, IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, PTE score of 58 or higher, Duolingo score of 110 or higher, or successful completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements: Applicants should have an undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants with a lower GPA may be admitted provisionally if they show promise in other areas. The GRE is not required for admission. Required application materials include: the Graduate School application form, transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, three letters of recommendation, a 1-2 page statement of purpose, and a resume or Curriculum Vitae (CV). English proficiency test scores are required if applicable.

EnglishScore: All students for whom English is a second language must demonstrate English proficiency before admission. Kansas State University accepts the following tests to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL (iBT), TOEFL Essentials, IELTS, PTE, and Duolingo.
Requirements:
To be admitted to the Master of Mass Communications program, students must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale in their junior and senior years.

International students whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency. Minimum scores for admission are 550 (paper-based), 213 (computer-based), or 79 (internet-based) on the TOEFL exam; 6.5 on the IELTS; or 58 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE).

Items to be included in your application:
1. A statement of objectives. Please provide a statement of objectives, double-spaced, of between 300-500 words describing your professional goals and how the master's degree in mass communication from Kansas State University will help you achieve those goals.
2. A curriculum vitae or resume.
3. A sample of your professional or academic writing.
4. Three letters of recommendation.
5. Official transcripts from each institution you have attended.
6. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) scores are optional. The institution code for Kansas State University is 6334.
ScholarshipType: Graduate Teaching Assistantships (GTA), Graduate Research Assistantships (GRA)
